wikipedia_page.main: Lord Douglas Gordon-Hallyburton (10 October 1777 – 25 December 1841) was a Scottish soldier and Member of Parliament.

response: In the general election of 1841 Gordon was elected to Parliament for Forfarshire, succeeding his uncle Lord Douglas Gordon-Hallyburton.Leigh Rayment, The House of Commons - Constituencies beginning with "F". Retrieved 23 October 2011 He also inherited his uncle's estates, and assumed the additional surname of Hallyburton in 1843. He was made a Deputy Lieutenant for Forfarshire on 5 June 1847 and re-elected for the county in the general election of that year. He remained in Parliament until the 1852 election,Joseph Foster, Members of Parliament, Scotland, 1882, p. 152 when he was replaced by Lauderdale Maule.
